Content:: Spencer Boldman (born July 28, 1992[1]) is an American actor. He is known for his role as Adam Davenport on Disney XD's Lab Rats, and for playing Gio in the film Cruise. Spencer was born in Dallas, Texas,[1] and graduated from Plano East Senior High School in Plano, Texas in June 2010.[2] Boldman's first major acting role was playing Adam, the eldest of the bionic teenagers, on the Disney XD series Lab Rats which premiered in 2012.[2][3] The same year he had a role in the film 21 Jump Street.[2] In 2013, he was cast in the Disney Channel Original Movie Zapped, opposite Zendaya.[4] In 2015, Boldman was cast opposite Emily Ratajkowski in the romance film Cruise which is set during the 1980s;[5] the film was released in 2018. In 2022, he was cast in the recurring role of Lance McCrae in Immigrant, the upcoming Hulu limited series based on the story of Chippendales and its founder.[6] Media related to Spencer Boldman at Wikimedia Commons  This article about a United States film and television actor born in the 1990s is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
